message: I'm looking for something that will approximately replace Textmate's functionality in this regard. A command or leader command + py (for example) that then either gives me a list of python .skel files, or inserts a basic default. What's the best/most Vim-like approach to this?
One I've heard of is tSkeleton (http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=1160). But i haven't used it before. Anyone have any comments/recs?
snipMate could also be used to do this (http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=2540). It is a clone of the TextMate snippets, but certainly could be used to create file templates.
I use snippetsEmu.vim and works great. I'm not sure where I took it from, If u need let me know and I try to upload it to bitbucket or something
